learnings.content: Run the full test suite before marking any waza complete.
Review all artifacts for completeness before advancing to the next gyo.
Record a kime (decision) with full options and reasoning whenever selecting between two or more valid approaches.
Surface gaps immediately — do not proceed past a gyo with a critical severity gap unresolved.
Prefer smaller, focused artifacts over large monolithic ones — each artifact should answer exactly one question.
When friction is detected, record a kansatsu before resolving — the record is more valuable than the fix.
Capture predictions before executing uncertain waza — unverified assumptions compound across gyo.
During research gyo, prefer breadth-first exploration then targeted deep-dive over starting deep immediately.
When a friction observation's taxonomy is 'stale-learning', include the ID or description of the contradicted learning in the 'contradicts' field — this enables automatic resolution during ma.
